thread.title: Kylier's Fans Are Outraged by Her Brand's "Gross" and "Sexualized" Blush Names
thread.title_full: Kylier's Fans Are Outraged by Her Brand's "Gross" and "Sexualized" Blush Names

author: Emily Orofino
title: Kylier's Fans Are Outraged by Her Brand's "Gross" and "Sexualized" Blush Names
text:
Kylie Jenner's Controversial Blush Names Kylier's Fans Are Outraged by Her Brand's "Gross" and "Sexualized" Blush Names March 23, 2017 Share This Link Copy What’s Your Reaction? Thanks for your reaction Don’t forget to share this with your friends! ← Use Arrows Keys → 1 Kylier's Fans Are Outraged by Her Brand's "Gross" and "Sexualized" Blush Names 
Fans were excited to learn of Kylie's upcoming blush launch , but for many, that enthusiasm quickly soured when they learned of the shade names. As you can see above, the titles are not for the faint of heart. The five colors are named Hopeless Romantic, Hot and Bothered, Barely Legal, X Rated, and Virginity (a relaunch from Kylie's Valentine's Day collection ). 
Twitter users immediately voiced their concerns. Some were just sickened by the names. "Can kylie jenner not sexualize young women w her blush names like 'virginity' and 'barely legal,'" Twitter user @purgatories asked. Most saw parallels to the makeup maven's own life in the shades, particularly her relationship with Tyga. "Kylie named a blush after her and Tygas relationship, awww," tweeted @clairebwalsh . But some just pointed out that controversial beauty product names have been done before. "Sweetie, leave the cheeky names to Nars and do less," said @TheRealKatPat . 
Read on to see the colors — and the comments about them on social media — and come up with your own conclusions before the shades drop on Friday, March 24.
